page.title: 08HEALTH
page.content: IF THERE IS AN EMERGENCY A DOCTOR IS ON CALL FOR PATIENTS IN THIS AREA, OTHERWISE THEY ATTEND SURGERY IN THE VILLAGE. SURGERY IS THREE DAYS A WEEK AND TREATMENT MAY BE ON NATIONAL HEALTH OR PRIVATE. APART FROM A COTTAGE HOSPITAL (SIX MILES AWAY) FOR MINOR COMPLAINTS AND TREATMENT, PATIENTS MUST TRAVEL 27 MILES TO HOSPITAL IN HEREFORD CITY. OLD AGE PENSIONERS ARE ENTITLED TO FREE CHIROPODY EVERY SIX WEEKS. THERE IS FREE TRANSPORT BY AMBULANCE, HOSPITAL CAR AND COMMUNITY CAR SERVICE. A DISTRICT NURSE ATTENDS POST OPERATIVE AND BEDRIDDEN PATIENTS IN THEIR HOMES AND A HEALTH VISITOR SUPERVISES NEW BORN BABIES FOR SIX MONTHS AFTER BIRTH. ANTE_NATAL CLINICS ARE HELD ONCE A WEEK. BABIES GET INJECTION FOR INFECTIOUS DISEASES.EYE AND DENTAL TREATMENT IS AVAILABLE.
